Pre-Game Insights: England skipper Jos Buttler hopes his injury-hit Twenty20 side embrace the challenge of facing a strong Pakistan team on their first tour of the country in 17 years.
This seven-match series is seen as a preparation for next month's Twenty20 World Cup to be held in Australia.
Buttler will miss the first few games to recover fully from a calf injury.

Two of England's World Cup squad members -- Liam Livingstone and Chris Jordan -- are also missing this series as they recover from ankle and finger injuries respectively, while Test skipper Ben Stokes was given a rest.

Seven of England's squad -- David Willey, Phil Salt, Will Jacks, Liam Dawson, Harry Brook, Luke Wood and Ben Duckett -- had featured in the Pakistan Super League (PSL) this year and would know local conditions.
The first four matches will be in Karachi on September 20, 22, 23 and 25, and the next three in Lahore on September 28, 30 and October 2.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Security issues have meant Pakistan has struggled to attract visiting sides since an attack on the Sri Lankan team bus in 2009, but tours have slowly resumed in the past few years -- with England the latest.
The England skipper also hoped his side would perform well to honour Queen Elizabeth II, who died last week.
